results.name: Triangle T(n, k) = n^2 + k^2, 1 <= k <= n, read by rows.
comment: The formula yields squares of hypotenuses of right triangles having integer side lengths (A000404), but with duplicates (cf. A024508) and not in increasing order. - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 05 2016
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..120 of triangle, flattened
mathematica: t[n_,k_]:=n^2 + k^2; Table[t[n, k], {n, 11}, {k, n}]//Flatten (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Apr 30 2014 *)
program: (MAGMA) [n^2+k^2: k in [1..n], n in [1..15]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Apr 30 2014
for (n=1, 10, for(k=1, n, print1(T(n, k), ", "))) \\ _Altug Alkan_, Mar 24 2016
xref: Not a permutation of sequence A000404 (which has no duplicates).
Cf. A002522 (left edge), A001105 (right edge), A219054 (row sums).
